com.facebook.buck.rules

Interface Buildable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCachingBuildRule, AndroidBinaryRule, AndroidInstrumentationApk, AndroidLibraryRule, AndroidManifestRule, AndroidResourceRule, ApkGenrule, ArchivingRule, DefaultJavaLibraryRule, ExportFileRule, FakeDefaultJavaLibraryRule, GenAidlRule, GenParcelableRule, Genrule, JavaBinaryRule, JavaTestRule, KeystoreRule, NativeLibraryRule, NdkLibraryRule, PrebuiltJarRule, PrebuiltNativeLibraryBuildRule, PythonBinaryRule, PythonLibraryRule, RobolectricTestRule, ShBinaryRule, ShTestRule

    public interface Buildable
    Represents something that Buck is able to build, encapsulating the logic of how to determine whether the rule needs to be rebuilt and how to actually go about building the rule itself.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getInputsToCompareToOutput

        Iterable<String> getInputsToCompareToOutput()
        Get the set of input files whose contents should be hashed for the purpose of determining whether this rule is cached.

        Note that inputs are iterable and should generally be alphatized so that lists with the same elements will be .equals() to one another. However, for some build rules (such as Genrule), the order of the inputs is significant and in these cases the inputs may be ordered in any way the rule feels most appropriate.

      • getBuildSteps

        List<Step> getBuildSteps(BuildContext context)
                         throws IOException
        When this method is invoked, all of its dependencies will have been built.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • recordOutputFileDetailsAfterFetchFromArtifactCache

        void recordOutputFileDetailsAfterFetchFromArtifactCache(ArtifactCache cache,
                                                      ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem)
                                                        throws IOException
        This method is invoked if the output file is successfully fetched from the ArtifactCache. This is where a rule has the opportunity to record any relevant metadata about the artifact.

        The default implementation of this method is empty.

        Parameters:
        cache - The ArtifactCache that was used to fetch the output file.
        projectFilesystem - to use to determine where a metadata file should be written.
        Throws:
        IOException
